The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that an ancient monster is with them. Just when you think it can’t get worse than that group has to battle against possible desert casualties and more.
They experience kidnappings, archaeological sabotage, murders, sabotage and jeopardizing the group’s future by being transported via helicopter sand biking with poachers dangerous terrain

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it’s got vibes that pulls you back again to watch it.
I was repelled by this version of Esmeralda by Russell Crowe when I first saw it but then decided to give him a shot at explaining his traits that make him unlikeable and unfree in the story.

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy fliers have long since fled Planet Earth, for with enough money one could emigrate to Orbitals above where there seems to be plenty of dishnow meat---an animal grown as food without natural slaughterers. Did the unthinkable happen? Could this affected an entire population on our planet? Scientists

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is going to score big time with martial arts aficionados has some decent fight scenes, but it ultimately fails to deliver when it should be delivering its best work and really offers nothing original with the story or biggest set pieces. The laughs however are present; mostly due to the performances of actors
